verses.roman:
kālenālpena rājarṣe
rāmaḥ kṛṣṇaś ca gokule
aghṛṣṭa-jānubhiḥ padbhir
vicakramatur añjasā

synonyms: kālena alpena—within a very short time; rājarṣe—O King (Mahārāja Parīkṣit); rāmaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ ca—both Rāma and Kṛṣṇa; gokule—in the village of Gokula; aghṛṣṭa-jānubhiḥ—without the help of crawling on Their knees; padbhiḥ—by Their legs alone; vicakramatuḥ—began to walk; añjasā—very easily.
translation: O King Parīkṣit, within a very short time both Rāma and Kṛṣṇa began to walk very easily in Gokula on Their legs, by Their own strength, without the need to crawl.

purport.content: Instead of crawling with Their knees, the babies could now stand up by holding on to something and walk little by little, without difficulty, by the strength of Their legs.
